effects: Cantrips known: 2 (gain 1 more at Fighter level 10).
Prepared spells: see the Eldritch Knight Spellcasting table (start with 3 level 1 wizard spells).
Spell slots: see the Eldritch Knight Spellcasting table.
Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one cantrip with another Wizard cantrip.
Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one prepared spell with another Wizard spell for which you have spell slots.
limits: You regain all expended slots when you finish a long rest.

effects: You can bond with a weapon by performing a 1-hour ritual during a short rest; the weapon must remain within your reach for the ritual.
The bond fails if another fighter is bonded to the weapon or if it is a magic item attuned to someone else.
While bonded, you can't be disarmed of the weapon unless you have the Incapacitated condition.
As a Bonus Action, you can summon a bonded weapon on the same plane to your hand.
You can have up to two bonded weapons; you can summon only one at a time.
If you bond a third weapon, you must break one existing bond.

feature_defs.trigger: when you hit a creature with a weapon attack
effects: That creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

feature_defs.trigger: when you use your action surge
effects: You can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, before or after the additional action.

effects: You can replace two of the attacks with a wizard spell of level 1 or 2 that has a casting time of 1 action.
